result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter J Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the Dirty P gang.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.   **AMENDED 05-21-2018:  CFTS

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim, D.A., (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with any members of Dirty P gang.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel. Defendant Hunter J Hanson in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Defendant Hunter J Hanson in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State indicated they are Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Atty Richards indicated they had no additions or corrections to revocation packet.  

State recommends 4 years WPS ( 2 years IC & 2 years ES)
Defense requests 4 years WPS (1 year IC & 3 years ES)

BtC:  3 1/2 years WPS (18 months IC & 2 years ES)
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
Undergo AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare,  and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Obtain GED or HSD
Full time employment or employment/school
No association with drug dealers, users, or members of Dirty P gang
No contact, directly or indirectly, with DA
CIP and SAT eligible
Firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY SCOTT AND KERRI HANSON***  No contact with the victim, LTR (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/his Atty and may attend medical and treatment programs.   No contact with MH.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-27-2015 - DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED FOR 2 HOURS ON THURSDAY, OCTOBER 29, 2015 BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 9:00 AM AND 11:00 AM TO GO TO PARK HIGH SCHOOL TO RE-ENROLL. IF DEFENDANT IS ABLE TO ATTEND SCHOOL, HE MAY DO SO DAILY.

Defendant Hunter J Hanson in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Lillian Lewis the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Defense asks for JT/FPT. Defense asks that bond be modified to remove GPS. The State objects to the modification of bond - argument put on the record

BTC: bond modification is granted. Must remain on GPS but is allowed out 2 hours on Thursday, October 29, 2015 between the hours of 9-11 to see about getting enrolled in school. If he is allowed back in Park High school, he is allowed to attend school  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
